intro: Paepalanthus parvus, commonly known as the small-flowered puya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. This plant is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Paepalanthus parvus is often found in rocky soils and is a member of the puya genus, which includes several other species with similar morphological features.
